Question: In 1869, long-time friends Frederick Douglass and this person found themselves, for the first time, on opposing sides of a debate.
Hints: The trial was moved to Ontario County, and this person spoke to more than 20 Ontario audiences before the trial.
Before retiring, this person was asked if all women in the United States would ever be given the right to vote.
In addition, this person got President Johnson to subscribe to the weekly journal before the first publication.
